This!
Also the golem not knowing that your newly made iron pickaxe should go to the chest, that has diamond, stone, copper pickaxes, same with any weapon and armor. These items aren't stackable, so this is already a nightmare. The golem doesn't know where to put it, so it either just stands there checking the same chest again and again and after a while it just drops the item.

So with armor and tools, there should really be only 1 of them, of any sort in the chest. Add enchanted versions as different ones, but it still should sort the enchanted ones, like books in the same chest, no matter what enchant it has.
I don't remember if the parrots have different dances, but if they only have one, I think the copper golems do too, and the most appropriate thing would be a robotic dance.
Yes and maybe if you move the happy ghast, the blocks stay in the air so you can make a structure in air
it would be so cool! it would be like having a moving house which would definitely be very fun to use in multiplayer servers/realms.
Maybe a special item like a ‚Äústurdy harness‚Äù that keeps blocks attached and building off of the happy ghast would make more useful and more used for its intended purpose

The main issue I have with this is that it goes against the lore of Minecraft itself, as well as the achievement title. The title "Uneasy Alliance" is implying that you helped the ghast get back home to the overworld, but then killed it. That is why it has the achievement has that title, and changing the means of getting this achievement would not line up with the story line at all.
Maybe happy ghasts shouldn't move in powder snow if a player isn't riding on them. This way, you could keep your happy ghast in place and not have to worry about it if you untie it from a lead.
Nice idea, same with drowning too I think!
No, the current speed is perfect for building, faster than that would ruin it. (It could be affected by speed potions tho)
Yes, speed potions would work well. possibly just giving the ghast sugar would speed it up.
YesÔºåI totally agree that speed potion can speed the happy ghast up!

I think the speed is great. You still have to option to give a speed potion if you want faster. But for building it is a very good speed. The amount of mobs this thing can haul as well is phenomenal. You can literally transport an entire village at once with it! Any faster would be op imo.
Add all of the colors of concrete and terracotta?!

Cool and useful idea üí°
What about smelting concrete and Terracotta to make them bricks and then you can have concrete and Terracotta brick blocks,walls,slabs and stairs.

smelting terracotta just makes glazed terracotta, which I don't think we need slabs and stairs for, but I think we should have a lot more then just concrete and terracotta variants, we should be able to cut logs, stripped logs and smooth stone allowing for smother transitions in building with logs. just picture a log slab sitting around a campfire, a small but effective addition to the game.

Concrete and Terracotta should be able to be cut using a stonecutter into Slabs, Stairs and Walls. 
I would also like to be able to do this with other materials, like Iron- and Goldblocks and all Wood-blocks.

Yesss this would be great. I have so many animals and I didn't know you used to be able to leash them to walls! Also this should be restored so you can go back to the Overworld cuz the Nether is a handful
You can, it is under the Multiplayer tab
Most people generally built "secret bases" which are not longer "secret" if people can locate your location, this feature should be dissabled by deffault
This would almost double the ingot cost of a functioning copper golem, and imo make the golem's function much less intuitive to players who are not reading the wiki for everything.

I agree, Copper Golems spawning with chests feel more like a way to test their behaviour than an actual developed feature, it would be better if they just spawned as it is, instead of spawning with a block under them

No? Making it not spawn with the chest will make it seem useless too people who don't follow updates, which is most of the playerbase remember. Spawning with the chest lets you easily discover on your own how it works by accident, otherwise people would assume it works like the other golems and set them up as a defense that ends up doing nothing. Spawning with the chest quietly tells you that it interacts with it without saying anything or making you go off the game.

I agree with the feedback. One crafting recipe should always result in only one item/entity created. If it is because the cost of ingots would be too high, the recipe for the copper chest could easily be change to 4 or 2 ingots. As for the functionality of the golem itself. I think that if you know how to make it, you probably have an idea of how it works.
The disc should be a sort of collectible instead of just being dropped almost every time by ghasts.
Agreed 20% is good, the ghast drop being 100% is way too much
no i think it is already too hard to get ghast drops because half the time they are above lava or bad terrain
Yes that is very good idea I actually posted a article about the tears music disc
I'm not against it but what would be the purpose?

It drops Land Snail Shell after death, as a crafting recipe for a new banner pattern: Swirl.

It can be bred with Glow Lichen.

A new block is a Snail Egg (Same as the Turtle Egg having a group of four.)
Yeah and just like the turtle helmet, the land snail could have a snail shell as a chestplate!

This sounds like a great idea, but I'd like to add a bit more purpose to the mob. I would be cool if the land snail left snail trails when it moved. If the player collects the snail trails, they could get nine of them to make a slime ball. This would not only be an effective farm for slime balls but could also be a better way to get slime balls too!

how would that work exactly..... it's an item...... it fits in your inventory, why have a specific slot for it......

it's like saying arrows should also have a specific slot..... at that point why not have a specific slot for food too, maybe blocks as well..... and pearls

it doesn't make sense, why add more inventory to an inventory
Solo quiero que agreguen m√°s espacios de inventario al inventario de objetos y ya xd

The guy in the comments saying "why not have a slot for good and ender perls and... ü§ì" brotha chill, an extra equipment slot for an Elytra so u can also wear your chestplate, is good. I also agree with the quiver as well, as long as it can hold more than 1 stack of arrows, otherwise there's no point.

No this makes no sense, the whole point of elytra is it nerfs you when you wear it, you have elytra and chest plate at same time would ruin alot (for example in the pvp world people would be running too much with no drawbacks) So no, no vote for me first person in these comments is right.

To the other guy in the comments saying the whole point of a Elytra is to nerf you, your tapped. The point of a Elytra is to be able to get to places faster, its basically a car/plane in game. And because minecraft isn't the real life thats why they didn't add planes. The point of a Elytra is to fly around you inbred. If u want nerfs then add mods to minecraft to make it harder.
I agree, I think it is only fair that this feature should be added. However, we also must keep in mind that the ghast is happy. Shooting is an act of war. However, your logic makes sense.
Yes, this! Plus they make noises too frequently. Just having 3 floating around your base is enough to drown out other mobs, ambiance, and worst of all the background music.

1000 times yes to this. I had planned to make a ghast garage in a large re-model of our mountain base, but honestly I've ended up killing 2 out of the 3 I had just to shut them up. There needs to be an easy toggle for their noise level, a way to shut them up entirely, or an enormous decrease in the absurd range at which you can hear them. I am about to kill the 3rd ghast out of sheer frustration.
Seconded. I‚Äôll be creating a specific location far enough from anywhere that I ever play to park him and will just take a railroad over there whenever I want to fly.

I'm glad people share my same sentiment. The range is obscene, I get that ghasts are normally loud but this is just annoying to have around my base. At the very least Mojang, please lower the range. It is just absurd. At least with allays I can escape their chatter like normal mobs. Having friendly mob sounds turned off is just what will have to be done for now.

Yes they are badly made annoying and don't fit the game compared to all other classic mobs from before , do they even test and play their own game, do they even like their own game they work on?

The sounds are triggering and so are copper golems sound.
I agree with this. It's getting ridiculous at this point. I love them, but my god, it's driving me nuts.
They are so loud and make sounds so frequent it's frustrating

I personally think copper chests should work not only as a function of the copper golum but as an alternative to the wooden chests, which will add a ton more use for copper in Minecraft.

Well, clearly, you live under a mossy cobble boulder. Let me explain. The Original Composer from 2009, C418, voiced the villagers, originally. And if it were AI, the pitch would be a lot higher, you'd be able to hear the lyrics instead of just "Hrmmmm" and you would've known, the team would be aware and they would change it. But since it isn't, you're just spouting a paragraph of utter nonsense and made up anger. And saying "Do better" isn't going to help your case, since you're just straight up being hostile. My apologies if my comment came off as agressive, and it might get deleted, but you get what i mean.
Even then it just sounds bad
It's not AI bruh, ever play Minecraft?

I think the golem should have "worse eyesight" as it gets more oxidized, as in they become less and less strictly with what is a matching item.

My suggestion is:

Regular Copper: Exact match (like it is currently)

Exposed Copper: Fuzzy match (same item but ignores NBT data)

Weathered Copper: Same tag matching (eg. oak, birch, wool, beds, swords, pickaxes, dirt, stone, etc.) 

Oxidized Copper: Match items of same section (eg. Colored Blocks, Functional Blocks, Combat, Ingredients, etc.)

This idea is very good for weapons:
Regular sorts swords with specific enchantments, durability level, and materials
Exposed sorts with only specific enchantment and material
Weathered sorts with only material
and Oxidised just sorts the tools in general without regard for material

I‚Äôd like to suggest the following sorting behavior depending on the Golem‚Äôs oxidation stage:
Stage 0 (unoxidized copper): the golem processes only completely identical items

Stage 1 (exposed): grouping by base material (all gold, all iron, etc.), with exact matches within each material

Stage 2 (weathered): division by processing type (raw ore, ingots, blocks, dyed variants)

Stage 3 (oxidized): sorting by creative inventory tabs (building blocks, tools, decorative items, etc.)

How about this: The Copper Golem's functionality deteriorates as it oxidizes, leading to increasingly chaotic behavior until it becomes a permanent statue:

1. Normal Golem

  • Behavior: Just as it is now, it sorts items with precision.

2. Exposed Golem

  • Behavior: Only sorts by item categories. Its sorting precision decreases, but it remains helpful. The following categories could be used:

    • Blocks: All building blocks etc.

    • Tools & Combat: Pickaxes, swords, armor, bundels etc.

    • Food & Drinks: All food and potion items

    • Ingredients: Crafting ingredients etc.

    • Others: Anything that doesn't fit into the above categories.

3. Weathered Golem

  • Behavior: The golem becomes unreliable. Instead of sorting by items or categories, it distributes items evenly among all reachable chests.

4. Oxidized Golem

  • Behavior: The golem loses its original function completely and acts randomly by opening random chests and pushes buttons and levers in its surroundings without a pattern. This chaotic stage preserves the original charm of the mob vote concept.

5. Statue

  • Behavior: Just as it is now, after some time, the fully oxidized golem becomes a decorative statue.

By implementing this tiered system, we wouldn't lose the charm of the original mob vote concept, but rather expand upon it and introduce a dynamic and engaging new mechanic to the game.
I think copper golem s should slow down as they oxidize
that sounds good
